Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Ramosin (natural AMPs like, salamanders, amphibians, animals; XXA; UCLL1c)

Literature.Author: Medina L, Guzmán F, Álvarez C, Delgado JP, Carbonell-M B. 2022
Literature.Title: Ramosin: The First Antibacterial Peptide Identified on Bolitoglossa ramosi Colombian Salamander.

Sequence Information.Comments: Discovery: sequence aligment and prediction programs.Database analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (62.5%) toAurein 2.3V=G:25%; S=L: 13%. Mol Wt: 1660.979; GRAVY: 0.92; Mol Formula: C78H126N21O19; mol ex coeff: 5550.Activity:  E. coli ATCC 25922 (MBC 17.5 uM), P. aeruginosa (MBC 35 uM), S. aureus ATCC 29213 (MBC 40 uM), E-faecalis ATCC 29212 (MBC >70 uM), B. cereus ATCC 6464 (MBC 70 uM).Toxicity: not hemo.lytic at 128 uM. Did not cause significant viability decrease for HaCat, MCF-7, and PC-3 after 24 h treatment up to 50 uM.Structure: helical in 30% TFE.
